For an interesting overview of self-defense in Britan see the following 
link:

http://www.cato.org/pubs/policy_report/v26n2/cpr-26n2-1.pdf

Mark Jaillet wrote:
>
> Am I the only one out here who thinks that defending family and home with
> any means necessary against a burglar "inside" your own home is O.K.? 
>  
> Bob,  do you know if there was prejudice against the sword itself or would
> the home owner still have gone to jail if he stabbed the burglar 
> with...lets
> say a salad fork?
>  
> Here's a question for everyone out there in Nihonto land,  can you briefly
> tell me how your individual countries feel about "swords" in general?   I
> live in Canada and we have major restrictions when it comes to fire 
> arms.  I
> will ask an RCMP friend of mine what would happen to me if I defended 
> myself
> inside my home with my katana against a burglar and I'll let you all know.
>  
> Mark
>  
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
> <mailto:nihontostudy%40yahoogroups.com> 
> [mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
> <mailto:nihontostudy%40yahoogroups.com>]On
> Behalf Of bob griffis
> Sent: Thursday, February 22, 2007 2:53 PM
> To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com <mailto:nihontostudy%40yahoogroups.com>
> Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Mysterious Do-gooder
>
> The laws in England have changed much in the last few years. For
> example, a gent was arrested, convicted and imprisoned for defending
> himself in his own home using a sword against an unarmed burglar who had
> broken into his house. I don't know specifically if possession of a
> bladed weapon is a problem, but any aggressive or defense use likely is
> a problem.
>
> Bob Elder wrote:
> >
> > Is possession of a cutting sword in England illegal? I
> > am going there to teach cutting seminars at 3 dojos.
> > Bob Elder
> >
> > > Mark,
> > >
> > > yeah, except that the British authorities are
> > > probably looking for the
> > > guy so he can be arrested for weapons violations..-.
> > >
> > > rkg
> > > (Richard George)
> > >
> > > Mark Jaillet wrote:
> > >
> > > >Finally, I positive modern day story involving a
> > > sword. How refreshing!
> > > >
> > > >Mark
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> >
